reviews.productTitle: ELEGRP Digital Dimmer Light Switch for 300W Dimmable LED/CFL Lights and 600W Incandescent/Halogen, Single Pole/3-Way LED Slide Dimmer, Wall Plate Included, UL Listed, 6 Pack, Matte White
reviews.text: I ordered a 6-pack of these and have had a lot of difficulty getting them to work correctly. 3 of the switches are now installed. The first has some occasional buzzing and flickering. The second seems to work very well. The third will only turn on the fixtures right after I flip the breaker; subsequently, the switch doesn't turn on the lights. I tested the fixtures with another brand of switch and it works. I've got 3 more of these I don't plan on using.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2025
reviews.title: Unreliable

reviews.productTitle: ELEGRP Digital Dimmer Light Switch for 300W Dimmable LED/CFL Lights and 600W Incandescent/Halogen, Single Pole/3-Way LED Slide Dimmer, Wall Plate Included, UL Listed, 6 Pack, Matte White
reviews.text: Ordered the six-pack late in the day and got them in on Prime the following morning. I installed the first two switches that following morning. The first one went into our den, where I had an ancient slider switch that had a broken slide handle. The other one went into our kitchen dining area, next to the den. So glad I opted for the six-pack as the unit cost per switch was closer to $9 each. At my big box stores all the sliders were in the $20+ range, which I felt was just too much. As for the promises of 'reduced flickering', that was one of the problems with our den ceiling lights. I'm running six of them. And with the old dimmer I had problems setting the lowest light level. The dimmer would either shut off or flicker. With the new dimmer, I can slide the switch to the lowest level, get a very low level light from the ceiling, and it holds steady. It's like a 'night light' level. So yes, this switch operates as I've wanted, but didn't have with the old switch. Overall, what with unit cost so low, and performance so high, I can only say that I'm hoping these dimmers last for at least three years. I'm guessing they'll go further, as our old dimmers did have long-life as one feature.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2025
reviews.title: So glad I ordered the six-pack, great performance, low unit cost

reviews.text: My dad is a master electrician and has seen a lot of stuff. He said they are made very cheap compared to ones at menards or home depot and those places have cheap electrical stuff when compared to electrical supply companies. I put them in my house regardless because I already purchased them. BTW they are the same price as the ones at menards or home depot. Only half work the others randomly flicker at different rates. We took a switch apart and found loose connections everywhere. The only positive is that they are pretty looking but they look the same at menards. Anyway I don't reccomend buying these

reviews.text: 3- way installation doesn't function. It flickers, period. This is a known issue, has been for more tyhan a little while, as the reviews show. I very much wanted to like these, but they are entirely disappointing. Worst is the flickering-- at about 50% dim, these flicker like a light show. So they really don't do what they're supposed to do. And now I have to uninstall them and install new ones. Also, these are clearly meant for stab on connection, because the screw terminals are maddeningly difficult to use, unless you're comfortable working upside down.

I’ll give them 3 stars for good customer service.

reviews.productTitle: ELEGRP Digital Dimmer Light Switch for 300W Dimmable LED/CFL Lights and 600W Incandescent/Halogen, Single Pole/3-Way LED Slide Dimmer, Wall Plate Included, UL Listed, 6 Pack, Matte White
reviews.text: I would say I got what I paid for but I think you can actually pick up less expensive dimmers that also have WiFi capability from Home Depot. I have to regularly remove the face plate and mess around with the switch on a few of these to get them to start dimming again. I have one that has completely stopped working. When I adjust the dimmer switch, it doesn't dim at all. If I remove the plate to test and physically push inward, it works. So there's some sort of defect and it's only been about a year. So I'll be swapping them out with the Home Depot ones from here on out.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2024
reviews.title: Most are still working

reviews.text: I bought 2 bundles of these. At first they were just ok but a couple months went by all my lights at full power started flickering. They have a lot of good reviews so I did not bother reading them. Guess I learned my lesson on that. Now that I read the reviews I see buried amount the great ones all the flicker issues people are having. I now question the integrity of all those reviews. Don’t buy these. There is a reason they are inexpensive….. they are cheap. I’m removing them because I’m now afraid of a fire.
